awd_abstract_narration: The construction and operation of new large telescopes both                     on the ground and in space requires the measurement of the                      brightness and colors for a sequence of faint stars distributed                 across the sky. In this two-year study the author will continue                 previous work extending a list of faint "photometric standards"                 in both hemispheres to the magnitude range 10-21. It is expected                that this and companion work will address many needs of astronomy               requiring observations of faint stars and galaxies.  In addition,               this project will contribute to a database in which standard                    photometry conducted with a photomultiplier will be compared                    with photometry obtained with "CCDs" (Charge Coupled Devices).
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences
